titleStmt.title: Learning to categorize objects using temporal coherence

affiliation.orgName: The Rotman Research Institute Baycrest Center

analytic.title: Learning to categorize objects using temporal coherence

abstract.p: The invariance of an objects' identity as it transformed over time provides a powerful cue for perceptual learning. We present an un-supervised learning procedure which maximizes the mutual information between the representations adopted by a feed-forward network at consecutive time steps. We demonstrate that the network can learn, entirely unsupervised, to classify an ensemble of several patterns by observing pattern trajectories, even though there are abrupt transitions from one object to another between trajecto-ries. The same learning procedure should be widely applicable to a variety of perceptual learning tasks.
